page.title: 04THE PARKS OF A-IN-M
page.content: The council maintain the Jubilee Parks, Wigan Road, which cover an area of 11 acres. Near the curved paths are wooden seats and a pavilion. There are neatly tended flower beds surrounded by lawns, colourful shrubs and long-established trees, which also form part of a natural area by the 6 tennis courts and 9 hole putting green. The Jack Brook winds its way into the park and under a bridge. In nearby Skitters Wood are sycamore, oak, hazel, beech, ash, birch, willow and hawthorn. The Countryside Commission has sponsored the planting of 25 new varieties of trees. Down Brook runs through the wood and under a bridge near the main pathways.Here people may sit on wooden benches and enjoy the wide variety of wildlife.
